[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Real Estate Listing System (RELS) defines requirements for managing real estate properties, including listing, tracking, and updating properties for sale.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RELS supports listing various property types, modifying their details, and managing availability.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RELS integrates with real estate databases and listing services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RELS allows agents to manage listings and clients to browse properties.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RELS supports desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RELS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: RELS secures data via TLS encryption and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RELS is optimized for managing up to about a hundred active listings.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RELS handles property listing, updates, and removals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: RELS is configurable for agencies of different sizes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RELS connects with property evaluation, inquiries, and financial services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RELS manages property listings and updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RELS is designed for real estate agents and property managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RELS is limited to about a hundred active listings.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RELS relies on accurate data entered by agents and regular updates to ensure property information remains relevant.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Villa: Standalone property with optional pool and street access.
Apartment: Building unit with floor and parking details.
Furnished Apartment: Apartment with a at least one-a few furniture rating.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage property listings, including additions and updates (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track property attributes such as area, rooms, parking availability, and pricing to support accurate listings (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow agents to add, modify, and remove listings (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall maintain details for each property type, including villas, apartments, and furnished apartments (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall limit active property listings to about a hundred (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for property management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update property records with minimal delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store property listings, including type, price, and area.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track additional details such as pools, floors, and furniture ratings.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for each listing.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with real estate data regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for property updates.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests property listing, updates, and removals.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Real estate policies, property management standards, and listing guidelines.
